Issues.Title: [Server Side] Add Support for cross Browser tab state per user
Issues.Body:
First of all the serversideblazor rocks, this is rather an enhancement.

In modern SPA's people tend to use the `localstorage `or cookies to store cross browser tab data for a user. Since we're working on the server I can image we can store this data cross tab via DI.

Currently we can store user data of the client side by creating an `AppState ` class and adding it to DI as a Scoped Service, which is stored per user per tab. However if we could add a class or service which is cross tab we can eliminate the use of localstorage. 

Basically add a class per user per browser tab/connection in DI, is it even possible?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Server Side] Add Support for cross Browser tab state per user" (#1208)

Issues.Title: Temporarily disable HtmlBlockPass
Issues.Body:
We've received a number of bug reports about 0.5.0 having regressions for markup that people are commonly using (#1204, #1203, #1198, #1193). It looks like each of these relate to the new optimization in 0.5.0 that represents static HTML as markup frames.

It's not yet totally decided, but one possible way forwards for us would be:

* Via this PR, temporarily disable the compiler part of markup blocks and release as 0.5.1 tomorrow
   * This wouldn't stop people from using `MarkupString` (etc) as the runtime bits would be left enabled. I don't think any of the bugs above relate to the runtime bits anyway.
   * People just trying to render HTML as normal like before would no longer be affected.
* We also collect precise repro cases for each of the above issues
* We fix any `HtmlBlockPass` issues or any runtime issues and re-enable it in 0.6.0 (or 0.5.2 if we decide to do a further patch).

We'll make a final call on this tomorrow morning. cc @rynowak @danroth27
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Temporarily disable HtmlBlockPass" (#1207)

Issues.Title: Chrome: ASP.NET Core Hosted Blazor app does not start if Windows authentication is enabled (Blazor 0.5.0)
Issues.Body:
Scenario: I have a Blazor app created using the ‚ÄûASP.NET Core hosted‚Äú template, using IISExpress to run the app. On the server project, I have the ‚ÄûEnable Windows authentication‚Äú checkbox ticked, ie. the corresponding part of lauchSettings.json file is
```code
"iisSettings": {
    "windowsAuthentication": true,
    "anonymousAuthentication": false,
    "iisExpress": {
      "applicationUrl": "http://localhost:8000/",
      "sslPort": 0
    }
  }
```

When I try to launch the application in Chrome, the Console shows an error and the application will not start:

```code
blazor.webassembly.js:1 GET http://localhost:8000/_framework/blazor.boot.json 401 (Unauthorized)
blazor.webassembly.js:1 Uncaught (in promise) SyntaxError: Unexpected token < in JSON at position 0
    at Object.<anonymous> (blazor.webassembly.js:1)
    at blazor.webassembly.js:1
    at Object.next (blazor.webassembly.js:1)
    at i (blazor.webassembly.js:1)
```

The ‚ÄúNetwork‚Äù tab indicates a problem with loading the blazor.boot.json file using the ‚Äúfetch‚Äù method (screenshot attached).
![chromefetcherror](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41726008/43272916-6e5f7bcc-90fb-11e8-9fdf-3eab4083d6a6.png)

 

The problem started to show after updating Blazor to 0.5.0. Before the update, all was working fine.
I‚Äôve tried many things to troubleshoot the issue:
- in Firefox and in Edge, the same app works fine
- I have tried to set-up CORS middleware on the server-side, no luck (but then I am not sure if this issue is related to CORS at all)
- if I run the Fiddler debugging proxy sitting between Chrome and the IISExpress server, the issue miraculously disappears and the application launches fine even in Chrome (after disabling Fiddler, the issue re-appears)
- tried to empty Chrome cache, disabled all extensions in Chrome, disabled all unnecessary middlewares in the server app -> no luck

Do you have any suggestions what might be wrong? Thanks.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Chrome: ASP.NET Core Hosted Blazor app does not start if Windows authentication is enabled (Blazor 0.5.0)" (#1200)

Issues.Title: Blazor debugging in Chrome - source of files cannot be displayed if the files are read-only
Issues.Body:
I understand that the Blazor debugging support is in an early stage yet. Anyways, here is an issue I've come into (developing on Windows 10, Blazor 0.5, latest Visual studio PRO, latest Chrome).

Scenario/repro steps:
- I have a project source-controlled by TFS, checked-in files have read-only attribute
- I run the Blazor app, activate the Blazor debugging in Chrome
- on the DevTools tab, I try to see source of a class in the myproject.Client.dll
I get the following error:

//dotnet:dotnet://34_29
Unable to open file  xyz (path to my file)

Exception:
System.UnauthorizedAccessException: Access to the path '............' is denied.
   at System.IO.FileStream.ValidateFileHandle(SafeFileHandle fileHandle)
   at System.IO.FileStream.CreateFileOpenHandle(FileMode mode, FileShare share, FileOptions options)
   at System.IO.FileStream..ctor(String path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access, FileShare share, Int32 bufferSize, FileOptions options)
   at WsProxy.MonoProxy.OnGetScriptSource(Int32 msg_id, String script_id, CancellationToken token)

Running Sysinternal's Process Monitor tool reveals that the "dotnet.exe" process is trying request the "Generic Read/Write" access on the file to be displayed; and that fails, as the file is read-only.


Desired behavior: I would like to be be able to view content of read-only source files while debugging Blazor app in Chrome.


Many thanks to all contributors to the excellent Blazor project.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Blazor debugging in Chrome - source of files cannot be displayed if the files are read-only" (#1194)

Issues.Title: 0.5.0 is decoding HTML entities
Issues.Body:
I have angle bracket HTML entities in a Blazor client-side app page ... ```html <h1 style="font-style:@@_headingFontStyle">@@_headingText</h1> ``` ... it would render that content out with the encoded angle brackets. The browser would render that as text ... ```text

@_headingText

``` I just did an 0.4.0 -> 0.5.0 update. It's apparently decoding those `<` and `>` into actual angle brackets. The browser is now rendering that content as HTML.

When I build Blazor app I get:
```
C:\Users\User\.nuget\packages\microsoft.aspnetcore.blazor.build\0.4.0\targets\Blazor.MonoRuntime.targets(11,5): 
    warning MSB3026: 
        Could not copy 
"C:\Users\User\.nuget\packages\microsoft.aspnetcore.blazor.build\0.4.0\targets\..\tools\mono\asmjs\mono.asm.js" 
        to 
"d:\Code\Git\MyApp\src\Client\WebApp\d:\Code\Git\MyApp\out\bin\netstandard2.0\dist/_framework/asmjs/mono.asm.js". 
    Beginning retry 1 in 1000ms. The filename, directory name, or volume label syntax is incorrect : 
'd:\Code\Git\MyApp\src\Client\WebApp\d:\Code\Git\MyApp\out\bin\netstandard2.0\dist\_framework\asmjs'  
[d:\Code\Git\MyApp\src\Client\WebApp\WebApp.csproj]
```
Output Path seems to be generated incorrectly:
`d:\Code\Git\MyApp\src\Client\WebApp\d:\Code\Git\MyApp\out\bin\netstandard2.0\dist\_framework\asmjs`

**Workaround:**
I added additional `Directory.Build.props` file in Blazor project directory:
```xml
<Project>
    <!-- Reference to my main Directory.Build.props -->
    <Import Project="..\..\..\Directory.Build.props" />
    <PropertyGroup>
        <!-- Override OutputPath with relative path -->
        <OutputPath>..\..\..\out\bin</OutputPath>
    </PropertyGroup>
</Project>
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Incorrect OutputPath when using $(MSBuildThisFileDirectory)" (#1179)

Issues.Title: Embed independent components in existing site
Issues.Body:
I have an existing site built entirely in Aurelia. As a demo to my organization regarding Blazor, I would like to replace a single existing component. In Aurelia it is possible to extend an existing application by calling an enhance method and providing a DOM selector.

Is there any way to accomplish something similar with Blazor?

Long term it would be nice to be able to import arbitrary components independent of them being rendered client side and hosted on CDN or server side and rendered by Azure.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Embed independent components in existing site" (#1180)
